name: Edmonton Marriott at River Cree Resort

reviews.title: Stay at this hotel!!!
reviews.text: This was our first time staying in this hotel and I have to say it far exceeded our expectations. The staff was extremely helpful and curteous, the rooms were very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The food in the restaurant was great. The workout faclility was a nice bonus. We were a little leary about the location but once we got here and realized that was only about 5 minutes from the West Edmonton Mall we were happy. We plan on being return customers of this hotel everytime we come to Edmonton and plan on spreading the word.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a night for his birthday. The hotel was nice, but nothing special. The room was very clean, the shower was nice and large. The room had nice beddings and a nice tv. I have slept on a more comfortable bed though. Considering they allow smoking in the Casio, the smoke was well contained there. Did not effect us in our room.The buffet at the Kitchen was so gross! We were there at the Asian theme night and it was so nasty. Even the bread was bad. The best part of the meal was when it was over. For $20/person there was not much selection and the food was really bad. I would stay there again, but I would go out to eat!
reviews.title: River Creek was just okay.

reviews.text: I travel alot because I am an adventurer and I love to enjoy nice things like new Marriott hotels. This one is a treat, it has't been around more than 2 years or so and it still has that "new car feeling" which is amazing. The casino on site is good for bringing in b rated shows, the last time I was here they had BOYZ2MEN playing here, ooops i missed that show, oh darn maybe next time[NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!] ok, but i digress. lets get to the nitty gritty.
reviews.title: This is my happy place.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The Lobby: Vast, huge, spacious well decorated, friendly staff, easy check-in. $17 extra per 24hours for in room internet connection [free business centre on site].
reviews.title: no refund

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The Rooms...
reviews.title: Easy access to the West Edmonton Mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very clean and quiet. All the staff we came in contact with were extremely friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the upgraded breakfast and cocktail hour. It seems far out from downtown Edmonton but in reality is not that bad of a drive, and less expensive than downtown hotels while just as nice.
reviews.title: Great accommodations outside of town

likes.liked: — value, cleanliness, friendly staff, breakfast and happy hour

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the Marriott Edmonton At River Cree Resort and loved it. We got an excellent deal for rates which was equal too a far less rated hotel than the Marriott. It is about a 5 min drive from the mall using the 178th st. entrance. They do offer free shuttle bus which runs about 19hrs / day every 1/2 hour to and from the mall also. We had a double room on the second floor which was just down from the pool. Front desk told me all 2nd floor have fridges in the rooms, In assume there were other floors with the same. Also a nice large LCD T.V in the room. Beds very soft as well. Right from the door greater to the staff passing in the halls, they were all very friendly. The room was very clean and they were quick to accomodate you with any requests. We had requested a feather free bed and it was feathers when we arrived. Within minutes 3 maids were there and stripped the beds and re-made them feather free. We never tried any of the dinning options at the resort but they all looked very nice. The place smells marvelous, it is also only 2 years old. The day we left Mr. Donald Trump and his sweatheart were to be checking in for a stay while in meetings in Edmonton. Also Mr. Marriott is to be arriving next week also, his first stay at the hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again and i would highly recomend that anyone stay here. The only downside is you have that drive to and from the mall or dinning if you venture out, but you would have to drive the same from any other hotel near the mall. Any questions, feel free to ask and I will try to help out.
reviews.title: Loved The Marriott, Close Drive To The Mall.

reviews.text: Nice Hotel, friendly staff, very clean. Hotel is overpriced though. It is no better than a new-ish Best Western. Internet access is way overpriced at $15.99 per day when the majority of Hotels offer this for free. Also, my family of five had breakfast downstairs which consisted of orange juice for all of us and coffee for my wife and myself. We had toast with one child having pancakes. Price..... $45.00!!
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: I would choose not to stay here again due to the fact that it try's to bill itself as upscale accomodations by, in my mind, overcharging for rooms, food, and other anemeties.
reviews.title: Beautiful Marriott Property
HOTEL ON INDIAN RESERVATION
reviews.text: We contacted the property approximately one week before our departure to Edmonton for a quick getaway. We checked the rates online of the Marriott Edmonton at River Cree Resort and compared them to those of a different property, the Hilton Garden Inn West Edmonton, whom we have stayed with before and had an enjoyable experience. The only availability of the Marriott was a concierge room. We then called the hotel directly and a friendly associate gave us information on what concierge service includes. Regardless of the mixed reviews, we went ahead and booked the room for two nights in late March, 2008, for a rate of approximately $199.00 for Thursday, March 27, and $189.00 for Friday, March 28.

Stayed at this hotel for one night only, found it to be very clean and new looking. The rooms were awesome, great beds and great big fluffy pillows. We wanted a hotel close to West Edmonton Mall and it was pefect, only 5 minute drive to the mall and lots of restraunts in the area. The pool was clean and the hot tub nice and hot...the work out room was awesome, very new equipment and everything in great condition. The casino was nice and clean and new. We requested a cot for one of our boys and that was brought to our room promptly and it was a great cot, very comfortable. The room had a nice large LG flat screen TV. This hotel was over a hundred dollars cheaper then the West Edmonton Mall Fantasyland hotel and the rooms were much nicer. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to the mall

likes.liked: — Great beds and pillows and very clean

reviews.text: We spent one night here and found the rooms very quite and comfortable. We stayed on the concierge level and this provided good value with a light evening meal and a nice breakfast. Chips and beverages were available all day. Although this is a nice hotel, I didn't find it to be very much like a resort. There is a casino and twin skating rinks, neither of which we visited and a very average hotel pool.
reviews.title: Nice rooms
great service..
reviews.text: This hotel was very easy to find we drove from Calgary airport . Reception staff were more than helpful on arrival, room was great very clean comfy and quiet. We used the free shuttle to west Edmonton mall the next day. We had breakfast and evening meal in the hotel witch were all very good and the staff could't have been more helpful . We would definatly recomend this hotel, good value, modern and friendly. Family of 4 from England.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for our mini "babymoon" because we assumed that it would be a relatively "child free zone." We arranged for family members to look after our 2.5 year old so were disappointed to find out that we were surrounded by kids.
reviews.title: Hockey and kid and partiers - oh my!
crappy booking experience
reviews.text: Beware that there is a large ice rink arena attached the resort. While we stayed here the hotel was crawling with kids and parents there for hockey tournaments. It was terribly noisy with kids screaming and carrying on throughout the hotel. People were drinking and carrying on in the hallways and the room walls are paper thin!

Super clean new facility.Unlike others I did not notice the smell of smoke entering the lobby from the Casino, which is a smoking area-the rest of the hotel smoke free. Rooms very bright and cheery, high quality beds and linens, except towels which were a bit cheapo IMHO. Location not far from WEM(you will need a car here unless you cab it). but not much in immediate area. Easy to find-only high rise in the area. Buffet food good but service a little confused(reluctance on part of our server to offer the ala carte menu, it also took three tries to get pasta from the buffet itself) , sports bar great. Grounds still somewhat a construction zone, though not offensively so. Friendly staff. Feather free duvets are on the heavy side, and a requested blanket resulted in the delivery of another duvet. Convenient access to Anothony Henday ring road and Edmonton Intl Airport, which is about 25 km away.
reviews.title: Great

likes.disliked: — Location rather remote from other activities

reviews.text: I could go on and on about our stay at the River Cree Resort, but I'll simplify:
reviews.title: Party People Wanted at the River Cree Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: :) Friendly staff, good food, short drive to "the mall"
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, But A Bit Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: :( Loud party people all over the hotel, 3 foot deep pool, fire evacuation of entire facility (turns out it wasn't a fire) at 3:30, clock alarm at 5:45, shooting murder in casino also in the middle of the night. Grumpy kids who didn't sleep = grumpy parents.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable room, as what we've come to expect from Marriott

reviews.title: More than just a hotel
reviews.text: Would we ever go back? no

aka: Edmonton Marriott At River Cree Hotel
description: The Edmonton Marriott at River Cree Resort is close to the airport and downtown Edmonton. This Edmonton hotel features complimentary shuttle to West Edmonton Mall, 3 restaurants, a casino, 2 NHL-sized hockey rinks, indoor pool, and fitness centre.
